titles.ar: بَابُ مَنْ قَطَعَ السَّعْيَ لِلصَّلَاةِ أَوْ غَيْرِهَا وَ السَّعْيِ بِغَيْرِ وُضُوءٍ
titles.en: Chapter 145 – The one who cuts off the Sa’ee for the Prayer, or something else, and the performance of the Sa’ee without being in ablution

titles.ar: بَابُ مَنْ قَطَعَ السَّعْيَ لِلصَّلَاةِ أَوْ غَيْرِهَا وَ السَّعْيِ بِغَيْرِ وُضُوءٍ
titles.en: Chapter 145 – The one who cuts off the Sa’ee for the Prayer, or something else, and the performance of the Sa’ee without being in ablution

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/78)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) الرَّجُلُ يَدْخُلُ فِي السَّعْيِ بَيْنَ الصَّفَا وَ الْمَرْوَةِ فَيَدْخُلُ وَقْتُ الصَّلَاةِ أَ يُخَفِّفُ أَوْ يَقْطَعُ وَ يُصَلِّي وَ يَعُودُ أَوْ يَثْبُتُ كَمَا هُوَ عَلَى حَالِهِ حَتَّى يَفْرُغَ قَالَ أَ وَ لَيْسَ عَلَيْهِمَا مَسْجِدٌ لَا بَلْ يُصَلِّي ثُمَّ يَعُودُ قُلْتُ يَجْلِسُ عَلَيْهِمَا قَالَ أَ وَ لَيْسَ هُوَ ذَا يَسْعَى عَلَى الدَّوَابِّ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Muawiya Bin Ammar who said,

‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘The man enters into the Sa’ee between Al-Safa and Al-Marwa, so the time for the Prayer comes up, should he slow down, or should he cut it off and he should Pray and return, or stay affirmed just as he is upon his state until he is free?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Or is there not a place of Prostration (Masjid) upon both of these? No, but he should Pray, then he should return’. I said, ‘He can sit upon both of these?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Or is he not like that performing Sa’ee upon the animal?’
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Mu‘awiyah ibn ‘Ammar who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘ Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who begins Sa‘y between al-Safa’ and al-Marwah but it becomes the time for Salat (prayer); if he can slow down, or stop and perform Salat (prayer), then return or remain standing until it is free. He (the Imam) said, ‘Is there no there Masjid on them? No, he must perform Salat (prayer) then return? I then asked, ‘Can he sit down on them?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘Is it not the case that he performs Sa‘y between al-Safa’ and al-Marwah while riding on animals?’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/78)
text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ يَحْيَى الْأَزْرَقِ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قُلْتُ لَهُ الرَّجُلُ يَسْعَى بَيْنَ الصَّفَا وَ الْمَرْوَةِ ثَلَاثَةَ أَشْوَاطٍ أَوْ أَرْبَعَةً ثُمَّ يَبُولُ أَ يُتِمُّ سَعْيَهُ بِغَيْرِ وُضُوءٍ قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ وَ لَوْ أَتَمَّ نُسُكَهُ بِوُضُوءٍ كَانَ أَحَبَّ إِلَيَّ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Hammad Bin Usman, from Yahya Al Azraq,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘The man performs Sa’ee between Al-Safa and Al-Marwa by three circuits or four. Then he urinates. Can he complete his Sa’ee without ablution?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no problem, and had he completed his ritual with ablution, it would have been more beloved to me<sup>asws</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 2. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Hammad ibn ‘Uthaman from Yahya al- Azraq who has said the following: “I once asked abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who performs three or four times Sa‘y between al-Safa’ and al-Marwah. He then urinates: if he can perform Sa‘y without wudu’. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful but if he can complete the acts with wudu’ is more beloved to me?”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (18/78)
text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) لَا تَطُوفُ وَ لَا تَسْعَى إِلَّا عَلَى وُضُوءٍ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Fazzal who said,
‘Abu Al-Hassanasws said: ‘You should neither perform Tawaaf, nor perform Sa’ee except being upon an ablution’.
en.sarwar: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Faddal who has said the following: “Abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘You must not perform Tawaf or Sa‘y between al-Safa’ and al-Marwah without wudu’?”
